column4: trying to connect from my mac to my ubuntu box at work, i get stuck at "expecting SSH2_MSG_KEX_DH_GEX_GROUP"
well, not the error
but where its getting stuck
on the mac, 5.2p1
(server)
just all of a sudden, im hanging at expecting SSH2_MSG_KEX_DH_GEX_GROUP
also, i only get this sporadically
i can connect, use it for 5 minutes, then it lags out
i try to reconnect, i get that message'
this is over VPN, the VPN mtu is 1444
'lags out'? What exactly does that mean?
gets slow to respond, keystrokes are behind
can't hurt to try Compiling's suggestion...
could be network constipation I suppose, but you'd expect that not to fail consistently at SSH2_MSG_KEX_DH_GEX_GROUP...
i agree
if the load on the office machine is unreasonably high, I would expect lag, and delay around the SSH2_MSG_KEX_DH_GEX_GROUP since that's where all the heavy math starts to execute...
it's just my workstation, there is no load
I can't explain it. Can you ssh into your workstation while it's bogged down and see what's going on that way?
When you're at work, can you e.g. ssh from work to home, then vpn back in, so you can see what the workstation is doing?
for all you know, someone is running a huge torrent at work, after hours, and clogging the net...
the lag isn't the bad part, its the fact that I can't connect
do you know if it's just your workstation? Can you reach anyone else's desktop?
no same problem
